text: Shen Kuo (or Shen Gua ; 1031â€“1095) was a Chinese scientist and politician. He lived during the Song Dynasty. He was a polymath, being good at many fields of study. Many of his most important works came from his use of astronomy. In 1088, Shen was the first to describe the magnetic needle compass, which would be used for navigation. He was also one of the first to suggest that the Earth goes through gradual climate change.
